ISSUE.TITLE: How can I backup my repositories?
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: I work in a company that doesn't use any versioning services because they are web based, I discovered Gitness these days and I need to make backups of project files to an internal server, how can I get the folders where the repository files are? I made a docker-compose.yaml so I could use gitness. ![image](https://github.com/harness/gitness/assets/47448206/551e6066-68fe-4244-b70e-b38c9bbfd465) I tried using the docker cp command but it did basically what docker-compose.yaml did. I'm new to docker.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: feat: [AH-667]: add unit test coverage for version details page > artifact details tab (#3433) * feat: [AH-667]: add unit test coverage for version details page > artifact details tab

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix: [CODE-3197] use logKeys from executableResponses instead of logBaseKey to fix Blob API (#3436) * fix: [CODE-3197] refactor * fix: [CODE-3197] use logKeys from executableResponses instead of logBaseKey to fix Blob API
